data.title: Frank Lebby Stanton (1857-1927)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Frank Stanton born 1857 Charleston, South Carolina, United States died 1927 Atlanta, Fulton, Georgia, United States including ancestors + 1 photos + questions + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[spouse(s) unknown]

[children unknown]

Profile last modified 26 Jun 2024 | Created 17 Feb 2019

This page has been accessed 115 times.

Biography

Frank Stanton is Notable.

Frank Stanton was born in Charleston, South Carolina however the family is not known to have lived in the city. He was born 22 Feb 1857 the first son of Valentine Stanton and Catherine Parry and in 1860 the family lived in St Bartholomews Parish, Colleton District, South Carolina adjacent to Charleston.[1] In 1850 his father lived in Chatham, Georgia[2] where he worked in a printing business.

His father passed away when he was about eight years of age and his mother, Catherine Parry, remarried to Thomas Malone and the family lived in Verdeir, Colleton District, South Carolina.[3] He married Leona K Josey about 1887.

He worked as journalist at the Atlanta Constitution for over forty years and was the first Poet Laureate of the State of Georgia, appointed by Governor Walker, a position he held until death on 8 Jan 1927.[4] He is interred at Westview Cemetery, Atlanta, Fulton County, Georgia.[5]

Writing thousands of poems, Stanton was sometimes referred to as the James Whitcomb Riley of the South. Stanton collaborated in the setting of many of his poems to music by composers such as Henry Thacker Burleigh.

His massive grave marker includes one of his most often quoted quatrains, "The World":

This world we're a'livin' in

Is mighty hard to beat.

You get a thorn with every rose.

But ain't the roses sweet?

Children[6]

Valentine - b 1893

Frank - b 1895

Marcelle - 1897-1989
